abstract: Jason Kilar, the new chief executive of the joint venture between NBC Universal and the News Corporation to distribute video online, has one tough job.
snippet: Jason Kilar, the new chief executive of the joint venture between NBC Universal and the News Corporation to distribute video online, has one tough job.
lead_paragraph: I’d say this is one unpleasant job description:

abstract: YouTube is growing far faster than any other video site, creating a high bar for the new NBC-News Corporation video venture that Jason Kilar will run.
snippet: YouTube is growing far faster than any other video site, creating a high bar for the new NBC-News Corporation video venture that Jason Kilar will run.
lead_paragraph: Just to expand on Saul Hansell’s explanation of the challenges facing Jason Kilar, the former Amazon exec who is slated to head the News Corporation and NBC Universal online video joint venture, consider this: Hitwise reported this week that YouTube’s share of all visits to U.S. Web sites grew by 70 percent between January and May. This is traffic to the YouTube site only, not video streams or views of videos hosted on other sites. The share of visits to 64 other online video sites grew by only 8 percent during the same period, leaving YouTube with 50 percent greater market share than those 64 sites combined.
